title.native: あの日見た花の名前を僕達はまだ知らない。
title.romaji: Ano Hi Mita Hana no Namae wo Bokutachi wa Mada Shiranai.
title.english: Anohana: The Flower We Saw That Day

description:
Jinta Yadomi and his group of childhood friends have become estranged after a tragic accident split them apart. Now in their high school years, a sudden surprise forces each of them to confront their guilt over what happened that day and come to terms with the ghosts of their past.

(Source: NIS America)
synonyms: We Still Don't Know the Name of the Flower We Saw That Day.
อาโนะฮานะ ดอกไม้ ความทรงจำ และมิตรภาพ
AnoHana: ancora non conosciamo il nome del fiore che abbiamo visto quel giorno

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Hikikomori
tags.description: Prominently features a character who withdraws from social life, often seeking extreme isolation.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

node.description:
__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

[Profile](https://www.imenterprise.jp/profile.php?id=74) | [Website](https://hayamisaoriofficial.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayami_official)  | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtUcK6HrhD024CkPDsURBwg) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hayamisaori_official/)

Member of the duet [Blue Drops](https://anilist.co/staff/106305/Blue-Drops) with [Hitomi Yoshida](https://anilist.co/staff/101088/Hitomi-Yoshida).

**Non-Anime Roles:**
- Elisanne (Dragalia Lost)
- Kamisato Ayaka (Genshin Impact)
- Munechika (Utawarerumono)
- Pramanix (Arknights)
- Rei Shijo (Princess Connect! Re:Dive)
- Tao Isonokami (Shin Megami Tensei V)
- Vector (Girls' Frontline)
- Shimakaze (Azur Lane)
- Kirifuji Nagisa (Blue Archive)
- Kunimitsu II (Tekken 7)
- Emma Millstein (The Legend of Heroes Series)
- Hulkenberg (Metaphor: ReFantazio)
- Caeda (Fire Emblem Heroes)

__Height:__ 165 cm

[Website](https://www.tomatsuharuka.com/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/tomatsuharuka-blog)

Tomatsu debuted in 2007, starring in Shinkyoku Soukai Polyphonica as Corticarte Apa Lagranges. Since then, she has had other major roles such as Lala Satalin Deviluke in To Love-Ru and Shiho Sannomiya in Zettai Karen Children. Before graduating from high school in 2008, she used to live in Ichimomiya city where she often took the shinkansen, traveling back and forth between Nagoya and Tokyo to attend recordings. On January 11, 2019, she married a man from outside the entertainment industry.

One of the members of the voice actress unit [Sphere](https://anilist.co/staff/103636).

__Non-anime roles:__
- Mary - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
Recipient of the Individual Award at The 16th Animation Kobe Awards in 2011.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/589238508)

Originating from [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/), currently affiliated with [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/589238508)

Originating from [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/), currently affiliated with [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).
Freelance. Close friends with [Takahiro Kishida](https://anilist.co/staff/101403/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

He made his full directorial debut with the release of [Honey and Clover II](https://anilist.co/anime/1142/Hachimitsu-to-Clover-II/) in 2006, after which he directed [Idolmaster: Xenoglossia](https://anilist.co/anime/1694/Idolmster-Xenoglossia/) in 2007, and [Toradora!](https://anilist.co/anime/4224/Toradora/) in 2008. He has also directed the spin-off series of [Toaru Majutsu no Index](https://anilist.co/anime/4654/Toaru-Majutsu-no-Index/), respectively named [Toaru Kagaku no Railgun](https://anilist.co/anime/6213/Toaru-Kagaku-no-Railgun/), which released in 2009.

Originating from Eagle Nest. Currently freelance.

Tanaka first drew attention for the wild and imaginative fight sequences in Precure [Max Heart](https://anilist.co/anime/1929/) and [Splash Star](https://anilist.co/anime/1534/). Following this he expanded his scope and took up work on productions all around the industry, showing that fights aren't everything he can do. His variety on running sequences, often showing an effiminate touch, as well as the particular attention to hair, down to all little strains and often involving a hairdo having a life of its own, are some of Tanaka's most outstanding feats.

__Non-anime credits:__
~!
- Chief Animator, Animation Character Design, Storyboard, Director, Animation Director, Key Animation for "BlazBlue: Calamity Trigger (OP)" (video game, 2008)
- Key Animation for "Disgaea D2: A Brighter Darkness (OP)" (video game, 2013)
- Key Animation for "livetune adding Fukase (from SEKAI NO OWARI) 「Take Your Way」" (music video, 2013)
- Key Animation for "Rurouni Kenshin: Meiji Kenkaku Romantan Saisen (OP)" (video game, 2011)
- Key Animation for "Valkyria Chronicles III" (video game, 2011)!~
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nabe_atsu_live)

**Height:** 153 cm (5'0)

__[Profile (Osawa)](https://osawa-inc.co.jp/women/kayanoai/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kayanoai_0913) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kayanoai_0913/) | [YouTube Channel Official Twitter](https://twitter.com/_kayanomi) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0D6qi-Gr5RW7hqOvTEKmAw)__

__Introduction:__
Ai Kayano is a Japanese voice actress and vocalist currently affiliated with Office Osawa.

__Biography:__
Kayano wanted to work in a job that would involve "healing people", leading to initially take up a course at a vocational school. She worked in the beauty industry and became interested in acting after having seen [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477/). While attending school, Kayano continued working in the industry and paid for her tuition.

Kayano began working at Pro-Fit in 2010, voicing two supporting characters in the original video animation [Princess Resurrection](https://anilist.co/anime/9159/). In 2011, she voiced [Meiko "Menma" Honma](https://anilist.co/character/40592/) in [Anohana](https://anilist.co/anime/9989/) and received the Best Rookie Actress award for said role at the 6th Seiyuu Awards. Kayano, [Haruka Tomatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/95890/) and [Saori Hayami](https://anilist.co/staff/95869/) performed the series' ending theme "Secret Base – Kimi ga Kureta Mono (10 years after Ver.)", a cover of a song originally sung by the band Zone.

She is often praised for her vocal range, having voiced a variety of characters such as [Mayaka Ibara](https://anilist.co/character/55137/), [Mashiro Shiina](https://anilist.co/character/61371/), [Darkness](https://anilist.co/character/89363/) and [Akari Kawamoto](https://anilist.co/character/24311/) for example, none of which one would connect to the same voice actress.

**Trivia:**
- Worked part-time at a coffee shop with [Chinatsu Akasaki](https://anilist.co/staff/107652/) before becoming a voice actress.
- She got around 100 suggestions for her nickname in the Anohana radio show, from which she herself picked out Kayanon.

Non-anime roles:
- Atago - Azur Lane
- Graf Zeppelin - Azur Lane
- Kaga - Azur Lane
- Renown - Azur Lane
- Y'shtola Rhul - Final Fantasy XIV

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomohikoito0218)

Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomohikoito0218)

Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/2256470167)

After graduating from high school, Kubota went through training at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/)'s research center before dropping out and joining [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/) in 1998. Three years later in he met [Sushio](https://anilist.co/staff/103619/) at Comiket, which led to Kubota joining [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/). There he made his debut as an animation director on the premiere of [Mahoromatic](https://anilist.co/anime/277/)'s second season.

In 2005, he made his debut as a character designer, although still jointly together with Sushio and [Takaaki Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/110187/), on the 6th [One Piece](https://anilist.co/anime/464/) movie. The film was directed by Mamoru Hosoda, which led to Kubota getting an invite to join the production of [The Girl Who Leapt Through Time](https://anilist.co/anime/2236/) as an animation director. After this he kept working at Gainax until going freelance.

In 2012, he worked as the main character designer on [From the New World](https://anilist.co/anime/13125/) and [Robotics;Notes](https://anilist.co/anime/13599/), and a few years later he served as one on [One-Punch Man](https://anilist.co/anime/21087/), which earned him international fame.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/2256470167)

After graduating from high school, Kubota went through training at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/)'s research center before dropping out and joining [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/) in 1998. Three years later in he met [Sushio](https://anilist.co/staff/103619/) at Comiket, which led to Kubota joining [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/). There he made his debut as an animation director on the premiere of [Mahoromatic](https://anilist.co/anime/277/)'s second season.

In 2005, he made his debut as a character designer, although still jointly together with Sushio and [Takaaki Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/110187/), on the 6th [One Piece](https://anilist.co/anime/464/) movie. The film was directed by Mamoru Hosoda, which led to Kubota getting an invite to join the production of [The Girl Who Leapt Through Time](https://anilist.co/anime/2236/) as an animation director. After this he kept working at Gainax until going freelance.

In 2012, he worked as the main character designer on [From the New World](https://anilist.co/anime/13125/) and [Robotics;Notes](https://anilist.co/anime/13599/), and a few years later he served as one on [One-Punch Man](https://anilist.co/anime/21087/), which earned him international fame.
Best known for composing the soundtracks for several films and television dramas. She began composing under the name “REMEDIOS” in 1993.

[Website](https://www.galileogalilei.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/galileo_news) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/galileogalileiphoto/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/galileogalileiofficial) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/galileogalileiSMEJ)

Galileo Galilei is a Japanese four-piece rock band who were initially active between 2007 to 2016, however they made a return in 2022 and have since resumed band activities. They are signed to independent record label Ouchi Daisuki Club Records (2022–), but were signed to SME Records (2007–2016). 

At their first Nippon Budokan performance held on October 11, 2016 it was announced that they would retire. After the band retired, Yuuki Ozaki, Kazuki Ozaki and Hitoshi Sakou continued in a new band named [BBHF](https://anilist.co/staff/174061).

The band announced a return on October 11, 2022 at the warbear's "re:bear" live concert after an exact 6 years hiatus. Upon returning their lineup consisted of two of the original members Yuuki Ozaki and Kazuki Ozaki, accompanied by Fumito Iwai and Masaki Okazaki. Their first album release after returning was Bee And The Whales on May 31st, 2023.

On August 30, 2023 they had a special collaboration with [Porter Robinson](https://anilist.co/staff/120603/Porter-Robinson) with a new take on the song "[Circle Game -ANOHANA Ver.-](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H6CE9uJwH8U)". The original version of the song first appeared in the movie adaption of the anime _[Anohana the Movie: The Flower We Saw That Day](https://anilist.co/anime/15039/Ano-Hi-Mita-Hana-no-Namae-wo-Bokutachi-wa-Mada-Shiranai-Movie/)_.

__Members:__
- [Yuuki Ozaki](https://anilist.co/staff/149245/Yuuki-Ozaki) (尾崎雄貴) – vocalist, guitarist, synthesizer, programmer, in-charge of lyrics and composition (2007–2016, 2022–)
- Kazuki Ozaki (尾崎和樹) – drummer, guitarist, percussionist, rhythm machine, synthesizer, programmer (2007–2016, 2022–)
- Fumito Iwai (岩井郁人) – guitarist, bassist, chorus, synthesizer, programmer (2009–2012, 2022–)
- Masaki Okazaki (岡崎真輝) – bassist (2022–)

__Former Members:__
- Hitoshi Sakou (佐孝仁司) – bassist, guitarist, synthesizer, programmer (2007–2016)
- Souhei Funaya (船谷創平) – guitarist (2007–2009)
- Kazumasa Noguchi (野口一雅) – pianist, organist, bassist, percussionist, synthesizer (2011–2012)

[Website](https://www.galileogalilei.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/galileo_news) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/galileogalileiphoto/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/galileogalileiofficial) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/galileogalileiSMEJ)
